meanings.definition: Inserting punctuation marks in written text.
meanings.sent1: She was punctuating her essay with commas and periods.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reminded the students about punctuating their sentences correctly.
meanings.sent3: The story was so exciting that even the punctuation marks were punctuating with enthusiasm!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter punctuated the room, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops punctuated the silence of the night, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.definition: Emphasizing or highlighting certain points in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: His punctuating remarks made everyone pay attention.
meanings.sent2: The punctuating words in bold stood out on the page.
meanings.sent3: The cake was delicious, but the punctuating cherry on top made it perfect.
meanings.sent4: Her punctuating smile lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with punctuating colors, leaving everyone in awe.
